title.en: Practical Works in Chemical Analysis and Metrology

faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: Practical classes in analytical chemistry. The focus is on giving the students practical experience on advanced methods of analysis: FT-IR, HPLC, LC, GC, AAS, AES (flame photometry), photometric and potentiometric analysis, different titration methods (acid-base titration, complexometry, coulometric KF titration, etc.) and sample preparation. Metrological aspects (measurement uncertainty, calibration, etc.) of analytical chemistry and data processing also have an important place in the course.
description.et: Praktilised tööd analüütilisest keemiast: proovi võtmine ja eeltöötlus, tiitrimeetria, potentsiomeetria, gaasi- ja vedelikkromatograafia, aatom- ja molekulspektroskoopia (FT-IR, AAS, spektrofotomeetria, leekfotomeetria jne), andmetöötlus ja metroloogilised aspektid analüütilises keemias.

objectives.en: To give practical skills to the students in advanced methods of analysis: FT-IR, HPLC, LC, GC, AAS, AES (flame photometry), photometric and potentiometric analysis, different titration methods (acid-base titration, complexometry, coulometric KF titration, etc.) and sample preparation. Metrological aspects (measurement uncertainty, calibration, etc.) of analytical chemistry and data processing also have an important place in the course.
objectives.et: Anda tudengile vahetud kogemused praktilisest analüütilisest keemiast: proovi võtmine ja eeltöötlus, erinevad tiitrimised, potentsiomeetria, kulonomeetria, gaasi- ja vedelikkromatograafia, aatom- ja molekulspektroskoopia (FT-IR, fotokolorimeetria, AAS, leekfotomeetria jne), andmetöötlus ja metroloogilised aspektid analüütilises keemias.

learning_outcomes.en:
Student knows the principles and applications of gravimetric, titrimetric, photometric, chromatographic, AAS and AES analysis. 
Student knows the basics of sample preparation in chemical analysis. 
Student knows the concept of selectivity and the main ways of achieving it (separation, masking). 
Student knows the possible sources of uncertainty in analytical methods and ways of minimizing them. 
Student is able to correctly use the basic analytical chemistry labware (pipettes, volumetric flasks, burettes, balances, magnetic stirrers, heating equipment). 
Student can perform weighing and preparing solutions correctly. 
Student can carry out basic sample preparation for analysis. 
Student is able to carry out chemical analysis with and calculate results for gravimetric, titrimetric, photometric, gas and liquid chromatographic, potentiometric, infrared spectrometric, atomic absorption analysis and flame photometric analysis. 
Student learns to use various instruments of analytical chemistry and will acquire basic skills in setting up instruments, managing them and processing data with corresponding software. 
Student knows the main IT approaches in analytical chemistry. 
Student is able to prepare a plan for conducting the experiment based on the given instructions. 
Student is able to evaluate the results of practical work according to the given criteria.
learning_outcomes.et:
Tudeng oskab selgitada põhimõtteid ja rakendusi järgmiste analüüsimeetodite kohta: tiitrimeetria, fotomeetria, kromatograafia, AAS, AES. 
Tudeng oskab selgitada proovide ettevalmistamise põhitõdesid keemilises analüüsis. 
Tudeng tunneb selektiivsuse mõistet ja selle saavutamise mooduseid (eraldamine, maskeerimine). 
Tudeng oskab keemilise analüüsi määramatuse allikaid ja võimalusi nende vähendamiseks. 
Tudeng oskab korrektselt kasutada levinumaid keemilisel analüüsil kasutatavaid laborivahendeid (pipetid, mõõtkolvid, büretid, kaalud, magnetsegajad, kuumutusseadmed). 
Tudeng oskab korrektselt kaaluda ja lahuseid valmistada. 
Tudeng oskab teostada lihtsamat proovi ettevalmistust keemilise analüüsi jaoks. 
Tudeng on võimeline viima omakäeliselt läbi keemilist analüüsi ja arvutama analüüsi tulemus järgmiste meetoditega: tiitrimeetria, fotomeetria, gaasi- ja vedelikkromatograafia, leekfotomeetria, potentsiomeetria, aatomabsorbtsioonspektroskoopia, infrapunaspektroskoopia. 
Tudeng õpib kasutama erinevaid analüütilise keemia instrumente. 
Tudeng saab baasoskused instrumentide seadistamises, juhtimises ning andmete töötlemises vastavata programmidega. 
Tudeng tunneb põhilisi analüütilises keemias kasutatavaid IT lahendusi. 
Tudeng oskab etteantud tööjuhendi põhjal koostada plaani eksperimendi läbi viimiseks. 
Tudeng oskab hinnata praktilise töö tulemust vastavalt etteantud kriteeriumitele.

notes.et:
Exchange students and visiting students who are interested in the course can contact the supervisors and will be 
admitted to the course if their previous knowledge is suffiient and if there are free places in the course.

independent_work.et:
Before each practical work student have to make acquaintance with instructions (see below Study Materials) and the theory of particular work to perform it. Student will prepare to answer questions concerning theoretical and practical questions of each work.
Experimental data which is obtained during practical work is treated according to instructions.

description.et:
All practical works have been performed safely. Student prepares first calculation file using the synthetic data given in Moodle and submits correct answers to precalculation test in Moodle to each practical work. After that student answers theoretical questions of particular work from supervisor before performing practical task. After performing practical task student prepares experiment report with experiment description, experimental data and calculation of results. Report is submitted or given to the supervisor within one week after performing practical task. 
Passing all practical works and acceptance of all experimental reports is prerequisite to pass to practical exam.

grade_preconditions.et: Practical works have been completed, final reports accepted.

grade_evaluation.et: For passing the course: If all practical works have been completed and reports accepted, then it is possible to participate independent practical task. This means that a student gets instructions of practical task and performes it independent and safely using the correct technics with labware and instruments. Student calculates the result and submits the report. Every student is followed by two assessors and pass or fail is an outcome of evaluation matrix (available in Moodle).
